Class TilesBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.softeng.is25am10.model.boards.TilesBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TilesBoard extends Object implements Serializable
TilesBoard Represents a ship board where tiles can be placed, booked, (or trashed). It offers methods to place a tile, to get it, to read its orientation, to manage the booking process of tiles (and to manage trashed tiles). To be added.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Tile[][] getBoard()

    • getRotation

      public Tile.Rotation[][] getRotation()

    • getTrashed

      public List<Tile> getTrashed()

    • setTile

      public Result<Tile> setTile(Coordinate c, Tile t, Tile.Rotation rotation)
      Attempts to place a tile at the specified coordinates on the board with a given orientation. Checks if the target position is valid (not out of bound), if the position is free and if there are tiles nearby (tiles can't be placed in the void, they need an adjacent tile).
      Parameters:
      c - the coordinate
      t - the tile to be placed
      rotation - the rotation of the tile
      Returns:
      a Result object containing the placed tile if the placement is successful, or an error Result with a reason explaining why the placement failed

    • getTile

      public Result<Tile> getTile(Coordinate c)
      Retrieves the tile located at the specified coordinates on the board. If the coordinates are out of bounds or the tile is a wall, an error result is returned.
      Parameters:
      c - the coordinate
      Returns:
      a Result containing the tile if the coordinates are valid and the tile is not a wall, or an error result with a relevant message if the retrieval fails

    • getRotation

      public Tile.Rotation getRotation(Coordinate c)
      Retrieves the rotation of the tile located at the specified coordinates on the board. If the coordinates are out of bounds, an error result is returned.
      Parameters:
      c - the coordinate
      Returns:
      a Result containing the rotation of the tile if the coordinates are valid, or an error Result with a message indicating the coordinates are out of bounds

    • bookTile

      public Result<Tile> bookTile(Tile t)
      Attempts to book a tile for later use. A maximum of 2 tiles can stay booked at the same time. Checks if there is space left (less than 2 booked tiles) and if t is not already booked.
      Parameters:
      t - the tile to be booked
      Returns:
      a Result containing the booked tile if successful, or an error Result with a message explaining why the booking failed

    • useBookedTile

      public Result<Tile> useBookedTile(Tile t, Tile.Rotation rotation, Coordinate c)
      Attempts to use a booked tile t by placing it on the board at the specified coordinates with the given orientation. If the tile is successfully placed, it is removed from the booked tiles list. Checks if t is in the booked list using the contains method in the Collections interface.
      Parameters:
      t - the tile to be placed
      rotation - the orientation of the tile
      c - the coordinate
      Returns:
      a Result containing the placed tile if successful, or an error Result with a message explaining why the operation failed

    • getBooked

      public List<Tile> getBooked()
      Retrieves the list of tiles currently booked on the board.
      Returns:
      a list of tiles that are booked

    • remove

      public void remove(Coordinate c)
      Remove a tile
      Parameters:
      c - coordinate to remove the tile

    • isOK

      public Set<Coordinate> isOK()
      Check if the board is a correct board. The combination Pair(-1, -1) in the return means that the board contains disconnected groups of tiles. The player must choose one by removing the tiles.
      Returns:
      the set of wrong tiles at the specified coordinate

    • countExposedConnectors

      public int countExposedConnectors()

    • countCannonsPower

    • countEnginePower

      public int countEnginePower(int count)

      Hit the board with the projectile.
      Parameters:
      proj - projectile to hit
      useBattery - ?
      Returns:
      the broken tile
